phrases: This sunshine, beating down on you from morning onward...
These students, who do not have a thought in their heads...
And having to hike up this steep slope every day from today,
It all makes me want to throw up.
Joining us from today is Nishimi Kaoru-kun, all the way from Yokosuka.
It seems he was at the top of his class at his previous school.
I hope all of you study just as hard as him.
I am used to this routine.
He looks like a real grind...
Their Kyushu dialect that I cannot follow...
Have you decided what club you are going to join?
They are made for each other!
Because of me, they picked on you, too...
Infantile creeps like that cannot do anything unless they are in a pack.
I am not interested in them.
It is not a good idea to antagonize the guy who sits behind me.
He is a notorious thug that even the teacher cannot manage.
His name is Kawabuchi and if he zeros in on you, it is all over.
Just thinking about it makes me feel nauseous...
I am Mukae Ritsuko, the class representative.
I was instructed to show you around the school during lunch break.
I am glad to meet you.
So the gymnasium is back there.
And the infirmary is in this building...
What Are You think you are doing?!
Um... Mukae-san, where is the roof?
I have moved from school to school ever since first grade...
If something unexpected happened, I would lose my equilibrium,
and even minor stress would trigger nausea.
But one time, I found a place at school where I could regain my bearings.
If I can just get to the roof...
You are the one that grabbed my hand!
You are the key burglar, huh?
In that case, I are not going to hold back.
This what you are lookin' for?
Then you goons are the thieves, huh?
The roof belongs to us senior smokers!
I want the key to the roof.
A candyass like you better get the hell outta here!
You want the key that badly?
Keep a holda this for me.
How reckless can you be, going up against three seniors?
This is what you wanted, right?
Do not tell me you thought I would give it to you gratis?
I put my ass on the line gettin' it.
Come to think of it, I did not even go to class once today, though...
City boy like that is got no common ground with us country boys.
I am not going to answer a guy who does nothing but fight.
H-He is Nishimi Kaoru-kun, a kid that just transferred in today,
supposed to be rich and a real brainiac...
From now on, your name is Richie.
Let us me and you be pals, huh?
I have got a favor to ask...
I cannot pay 100,000, but could you lend me the key just this once?
There is no problem if I take an umbrella!
This are not much fun at all.
I am not up here to have fun.
Then why bother comin' up here?
If you are bored, you can always go back.
You are giving me the creeps!
Richie, you take a shower, too!
What are you scared of, huh?
Nothing good's ever come of fear.
Let yourself get a little wet!
Because me no end of trouble...
We are going right to the infirmary so you can borrow a towel!
I will get your gym clothes!
I play piano, classical music though...
I did not notice with the glasses on,
but you have a really pretty face, Nishimi-san.
Oh, is it rude to call a man pretty?
I am a human hair dryer, is all!
There he goes again, bein' scared.
How could I be afraid anymore?
After all... that rain felt great, way better than I imagined...
Even with everyone staring at me, I can breathe normally...
What kind of magic is this?
Being able to play the piano, even being a sailor?
Kaoru, I am going to be away again for quite a while.
Be a good boy while I am gone, okay?
When I play the piano, I can forget all of the bad stuff
and the loneliness from Dad being away.
Your uncle in Kyushu has a huge grand piano.
Dad... I do not want a grand piano...
You are up really early today, huh?
You want to play the piano?
Mariko feels like hearing a tune that will wake her up.
But playing this early in the morning would be...
But I want to hear it right now!
Mariko will take responsibility, so please!
What do you think you are doing?
Playing the piano at this hour...
Do not you have any sense?!
This is why I told you to stop it...
Putting the blame on someone else...
I guess it is difficult for a father to raise a child alone...
Although it is your mother who is responsible, for abandoning the both of you...
Sentaro did not come today, huh?
Maybe you are lonely without him here?
I was not able to comprehend that question.
I will be quite pleased if he sees fit to extend his absence.
It looked to me like you two were hitting it off...
Everyone else is afraid of Sentaro, but you act normally in front of him.
I bet you and Sentaro could become buddies, Nishimi-san.
Give me a break with that smile...
Really, as his childhood friend, I can guarantee it.
So that is why you are so casual with each other's names.
Oh, you can call me by my name too, Nishimi-san.
And then maybe I will call you... Kaoru-san.
Sorry I said that without asking.
If you do not like it...
I do not mind it at all...
Do you happen to know of a record shop in town that sells classical music?
We have got tons of records at my place!
You know what I really mean by inviting you over, do not you... Kaoru-san?
I-I think things are moving too fast...
Is this how Kyushu girls behave?
Your daughter has been very kind...
The classical records are over on that shelf, Kaoru-san.
What kind of records are you looking for?
I play the piano myself, you see...
Oh, it is not a big deal...
Outsiders are not allowed in there.
Dad, Kaoru-san is a good friend of mine and Sentaro.
No, I am not his friend, just a...
What the hell are you doing here?!
Th-That is what I want to ask you!
Kaoru-san says he can play piano!
But bet you anything it is just rich kid stuffed shirt classical stuff.
Jazz is the only music for me.
Say, Kaoru-san, go on and play the piano!
Ri'ko, only jazz is allowed in here!
If it is the piano you want, I will play it.
If you play it without feelin' it, it do not sound like no jazz to me!
Say, I would love to hear you two do a session together!
This guy do not get jazz and he is got no sense for it.
A little practice and playing that will be a cinch!
Thank you for having me over.
Ri-chan, do you know the name of the tune he was playing on the piano?
The only thing Sen can play on the piano is the intro to this.
Art Blakey and the Jazz Messengers' Moanin'.
Was not he here to buy classical music?
This is how I always walk.
You are running down this slope that I hate so much like it is nothing...
What can you see beyond the hill?
Is it an outlook that I have never seen?
